skillTree.localised_description: With its magnificent frame and the great plumes of steam of its snorting breath, the stag instils unflinching valour into those who ride it.

attributes.description: Vanguard Deployment||This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: Many of Taal's priests wear a stag skull as a symbol of their devotion and the Forest Lord's power can be used to emulate the speed and beauty of this magnificent beast.
Rhya, the Mother Goddess shall provide succour for her children.
Taal's blessing grants this character additional skill in navigation and outdoor survival.

effects.description: This character becomes able to see enemies hiding in forest regardless of distance

skillTree.localised_description: Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Many an armoured knight has been knocked to the ground by the surprising strength of the followers of Taal. Although traditionally called "Bear's Paw" this prayer is sometimes referred to as "Moose's Breath" by those who have felt its power.

It is said that when Taal walked the earth, living things would spring up behind him as he passed. A portion of his power can be summoned by his followers to help regrow forests and aid in the return of the land to its natural state.
When Taal's name is invoked three times and the blood of an eagle is poured on the ground, the Lord of the Wild will cause thunder to rumble and the earth to shake.
Taal is the master of all beasts both great and small. Those who anger him may be mauled by a mountain lion or drowned in a flood caused by an angry beaver.

The Kin of Taal spend a great deal of their time building and sitting in sweat lodges, consuming alcohol, and using hallucinogenic substances to induce powerful altered states of mind. They lead men into the deep forest, where they dance, drink, and drum for days or weeks on end, or host wild hunting parties where the game is cooked and eaten in honour of Taal, along with gallons of powerful moonshine.

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

effects.description:
Ability: "Fear No Evil" for Celebrants units
	(Hero's army)

ui_effects.localised_text: Entities cannot die while ability is active

skillTree.localised_description: The Wardens are the stalwart defenders of Taal and Rhya's sacred locations, protecting them from the incursions of Beastmen, Greenskins, and ignorant citizens of the Empire who may not know what they are doing. Wardens are known for their quiet, serious, and often mysterious behaviour, and are rightly feared for the passion they have in defending Taal and Rhya's sacred locations.

effects.description:
Attribute: Stalk for Horned Hunters units
	(Hero's army)

Enables sundering attacks for Horned Hunters units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Bringers of Bounty perform rituals on crops and livestock, asking their Gods for growth and fecundity. Most are well versed in farming and animal husbandry, and are sought by commoners for their practical knowledge as much as their blessing. They organise local festivals and rituals to celebrate the equinoxes and solstices, guard the spirits of corn and wheat fields, and aid women in childbirth.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20

Passive ability: "Healing Hands" for Daughters of Rhya units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "By earth, tree, and bone."
There is nothing but utter belief. There is no reasoning with this one.
"Don't look into their eyes, there is only death there!"
Such is this one's conviction that others have no choice but to believe.
Speaking words of power or faith can alter perceptions on the battlefield.
You growl wild prayers to Taal, and they fill you with wild rage.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

skillTree.localised_description: Your prayers imbue a character with the constitution of an ox.
An omen, a sign - this being knows things and any who follow will share their glory.
This one will not go down easily - it will be necessary to break both the will and the body first.
This one fights with a fervour to be both admired and despised.
You command a beast with the authority Taal, and it complies.

ui_effects.localised_text: Spawns a unit of Great Hawks

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: All will listen, for the news will either be dire or wonderful.

effects.description: Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 10
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 20
Stimulate Growth action: Growth is modified by an additional 30

skillTree.localised_description: It is not just the forces of Chaos that can despoil, break and ruin.

effects.description: Damage Building action: Additional 5% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 15% damage caused
Damage Building action: Additional 30% damage caused

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.description: Vanguard Deployment||This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A regal air? Let's see how long that lasts.
"The smallfolk should be thankful - without us, who would they work for?"

effects.description:
Construction time: -25% for all buildings
	(local region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Franz has put his trust in this man; pray he does not let him down!
"If it's got a scent and footprints, I'll find it. Also, it helps if it's absolutely huge and can be spotted a league away."
The thrill of the chase, the tremor as the quarry is cornered, the ecstasy of the kill. These are the things that matter.
Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!
Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.
Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.
If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
